website_summaries.verdict: The best BenQ monitor perfect for high quality gaming, image/video viewing, and general use.
pros: Comes with an extremely fast response time for better gaming results
High amount of contrast in image
cons: Control buttons for the monitor's settings are located behind the display instead of out front

customer_reviews.title: Bought it for my Xbox One X
customer_reviews.text: Supports everything I need for my Xbox One X HDR 10 freesync 4K 60 FPS 1ms response time The controls on the monitor kind of suck but I don’t mess with those anyways
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Bad Monitor
customer_reviews.text: The colors are terrible. They look washed out. Blacks are not black, they are a dark gray. It's as if the entire screen has a haze of gray over it. I fiddled with the settings for an hour and nothing I did could fix it. I ordered a different brand of 4K monitor and it looks beautiful. This is the first time using a BenQ monitor. Not impressed. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Jason A

customer_reviews.title: Colors in HDR are washed out
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had it for about a month and it worked great but out of the blue all of my games played in hdr looked washed out. I didn’t know why so I changed the setting in my Xbox and didn’t allow hdr this fixed the colors but they didn’t work in hdr anymore. So I can play games in 4K but not 4k hdr FIRST PIC IS REGULAR 4K AND SECOND IS 4K HDR
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: DO not waste your monry
customer_reviews.text: I just got my monitor today. I turned it on to make sure it was working before redoing my set up. Worked great was very happy with everything. I then go to rearrange my set up and I went to use it and nothing black screen. Thank goodness Amazon has their support Jona helped me to figure out this unit is broken and I am currently working on returning the broken monitor. Benq however from what I was getting has not the best support since I couldnt talk to anyone right away but was able to leave a voice mail.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price.
customer_reviews.text: It’s a nice product for the price. It’s has a good bright, vibrant, and clear 4K picture. The settings button feel a little cheesy but they work. The setting menu is not the easiest to navigate but it’s not the worst. The speakers work, not the loudest and not the greatest quality of sound but let’s be honest if you want sound you buy a stand alone sound bar/system. Setup is a breeze. Haven’t had any issues yet and don’t think i will. I would buy again and/or the next years model. I also have recommended to some of my gaming friends.
customer_reviews.author: KEAAN L.

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you mess around with the settings
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Xbox one X since my 4K tv is not full HDR. I wanted a monitor match all of the xbox specs and this monitor matched with 4K HDR 60hz and 1ms. Has some truoble at first getting the serting I wanted but thanks to the xbox calibration Infound that some games inclusing Halo 5 can run with sRBG which made my chin drop. It’s perfect for those looking to have an edge over those with just 4K since I noticed every movement with way less blurr.
customer_reviews.author: Eye_Complain

customer_reviews.title: Greyed-Out Colors; Crappy TN Panel; HDR mode is Fake and Actually Makes the image quality Worse.
customer_reviews.text: This Monitor Is A Lie. The colors are literally worse than those on the screen of my old Dell laptop. I got this to play on my Gaming PC and PS4 and I didn't even have to boot up a game to see that the colors are just greyed-out and awful, even with the device-based HDR turned on. I've tried looking up other people's calibration settings online, but no matter how much I tweak with the settings, the colors wont un-bleach. The only redeeming quality of this monitor is that its 4K image isn't as pixelated as my last one.
customer_reviews.author: J Fuller

customer_reviews.title: Beware of paid reviews!
customer_reviews.text: Let me start off by saying this monitor looks okay during normal use and the response time is pretty good for an IPS but it's important to note that BenQ paid a lot of reviewers and YouTubers to give this monitor a good image upon release. The truth is it has some of the worst ips glow I've seen on a monitor and some of the glow is tinted a yellowish color so anywhere it happens on the display, it tints the whites on the screen. I definitely do not recommend this monitor for this price, the lack of quality control and shady marketing are instant turn-offs.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: This is a great monitor for the price
customer_reviews.text: The picture quality is great. And it gets plenty bright enough for me. I am sitting at a desk and in a room I keep darker. But even in the day when the room is lit up some it is still more than bright enough. Works great on my PC. And on my Xbox One X it give almost every option. Does not have Dolby Vision or 24 or 50 Hz for apps. But it does all the rest. The HDR 10 look pretty good. Better picture than my other 4k screen which cost as much as this.
customer_reviews.author: Crazy Logic Error

customer_reviews.title: Great Monitor/However.....
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these to run my computer/streaming setup. It's a absolutely great monitor. Great sound, colors, menus. HOWEVER. One of the two has a very small dead pixel in the bottom right hand corner. (Normal people may not notice) however I do. And it's my only negative thing I can say about these monitors. Cant notice it on games go often because of constant moving. But my black background shows it quite easy. 9.5/10 would buy again. BenQ has a odd warranty on new monitors. 5 dead pixels of white color. However I will probably use it for my secondary instead of primary.
customer_reviews.author: Tevon Maples

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor to substitute TV
customer_reviews.text: The TV market right now is awful, so I opted to buy this monitor for playing console games. I was iffy at first, but now I don't regret the purchase at all. The controller is invaluable, and the stock speakers are surprisingly good (better than my jank soundbar). The one downside is the volume control on the remote is beyond slow, and the volume on the monitor is borderline functional (if you scroll too fast it does not register the volume change, and actually randomly adjusts the volume up or down)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for 4K general work, not so great for HDR
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace my failing Apple Cinema Display from years (decade?) ago. I was hoping for better HDR support, but it really doesn't seem to do anything in that respect. But is is nice and crisp with decent colors for normal desktop work. I've played a few games on it and it is fine for 60hz, but I mostly use it for general desktop work or audio production. It is high res and easy on the eyes.
customer_reviews.author: Thanatopsis

customer_reviews.title: Amazing quality for everything BUT youtube
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for myself as a birthday gift and I have not had any problems at all. The only thing is that when I stream youtube videos on full screen the quality is pretty poor. With that said the quality when playing online video games like warzone is amazing so it could just be a youtube problem or just my own internet connection. Perfect for multitasking and easy on the eyes. I'm using my monitor at least 10 hours a day and not once have I had eye fatigue.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Great Monitor.
customer_reviews.text: Decided to upgrade my old BenQ XL2430 to the 24.5 Inch EX2510. This is my first IPS monitor and it's quite impressive. I'm a console player (PS4 Pro) so 144hz is more than enough as the PS4 only runs at 60hz. The response time is great and picture quality/clarity is great as well. Menu options are simple and easy to navigate. I wasn't expecting much out of the Speakers but they're pretty good. Volume only goes to 50 but it's more than loud enough. I can hear music playing from a different room. If you don't have a need for 4k, this monitor gets the job done. I definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Slick Bundy

customer_reviews.title: Very awesome monitor
customer_reviews.text: This is a mega upgrade then my old monitor. Lucky I had a few buddies point me into the right direction for a good monitor and a plus for it was on sale for cyber Monday.
customer_reviews.author: Project Pat

customer_reviews.title: Great input lag horrible display
customer_reviews.text: Was excited to receive this monitor but that didn't last long. While it has great response times and input lag the display is just not good. Colors are completely washed out and blacks look almost grey. No point in the great input lag if the display is horrible and you can't see the enemy. My best advice is to steer clear of this one.
customer_reviews.author: bigleechew

customer_reviews.title: Abismal color reproduction.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: 4k Gen1 Freesync (this particular monitors freesync does not work with Nvidia cards) Zero input lag Cons: Terrible color looks washed out 100% of the time even with lots of adjusting. Not bright enough TN panel Horrible black level Fake HDR Only 60hz Works great as a budget responsive gaming monitor if you don't care at all about color reproduction and don't play any games with dark environments. I personally don't recommend this monitor infact I dislike it so much I've ordered a new one after having used this for a little over a year. At this price point there are far better options.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Glenn

customer_reviews.title: Excellent entry level 4K monitor.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent budget monitor for console gaming. The response time is excellent. The 60hz is all you need for console, matched with the 4K makes for a pretty solid experience. My only complaint is that the monitor can’t truly run HDR because the screen is rated for 300nitts. When HDR requires 400nitts minimum to run. This causes a lack of brightness, but for the price, I can not complain about the product. Definitely a good entry level 4K monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: while shadows all over when scroll up/down screen page, hurt eyes badly
customer_reviews.text: this is a very bad monitor! First time I see a monitor does this, try all display modes and eye care modes, resolutions, and etc., very disturbing .....; whenever you scroll the display, there are white/blue shadows behind texts!!
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: The “everything” monitor!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this now for a few months and I can say that I still love it. It’s a great “everything” monitor. It’s not the greatest of gaming monitors if you are trying to go pro, but if you watch shows and movies or do school work on it as well then this is for you. On top of all of it, the speakers on this thing need to be heard in person to believe them. Insane! These are better than most tv stock speakers. No regerts...not one letter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BenQ EL2870U 28 inch 4K Monitor for Gaming 1ms Response Time, FreeSync, HDR, eye-care, speakers
customer_reviews.text: 10-14-2020 - My new BenQ EL2870U 28" 4K Monitor arrived yesterday afternoon. Assembly is simple, completed install of base in minutes. Connected to my computer and witnessed 4K Resolution for the first time on ANY of my computers! Colors are sharp and clear, the best I've ever seen. "Standard" Resolution that my computer defaulted to is 3840x2160 @ 60 Hz. I HIGHLY recommend BenQ for 4K UHD Monitors!
customer_reviews.author: Scott Kuehner

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Color issues -
customer_reviews.text: This monitor while watching / viewing content @ 4K it GOOD (Not great). When viewing any content @ 1080 / 1440 P the color saturation is so unwatchable, all black/dark colors are extremely pixelated to the point where it is impossible to watch anymore. If you are using this monitor for SOLELY 4k purposes I would still recommend a different monitor, this monitor is borderline useless for 1080 p related content (pretty much all of YouTube and Netflix)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: OK Monitor
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this monitor. However, I can't say that I loved it. The colors were off, and the screen seemed like it was too bright. I tried every setting on the monitor to adjust colors but could not get it anywhere close to my DELL monitor. I ended up returning it and buying another DELL monitor. You might like this monitor, but it wasn't for me. It is also a bit bulky. I prefer thinner monitors.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for an excellent price
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my son for his 21st birthday. He needed a monitor as he left his other two in a storage unit near his college when he returned home in March due to COVID. He loves the flicker-free 144Hz and the accurate color. It works great for both distance learning and gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Archer

customer_reviews.title: Serious display for gamers who care about quality.
customer_reviews.text: This display is amazing. 1440 @ 144 looks far better than most 4k monitors. If you have the pc to deliver high frame rates in 1440 and want a high refresh this is the only display I’d choose. Running a 9900k at 5.3ghz with a evga ftw ultra 2080ti to mine and I couldn’t be happier with it. The colour saturation is bright and vivid, you get hdr10 on it, the sound through its speakers is actually outstanding. Can’t go wrong with this one.
customer_reviews.author: M. Gattus

customer_reviews.title: dark black looks like dark grey
customer_reviews.text: Can someone tell me how to set up the monitor so that the dark black will not show up like dark grey? I tried many setting of the monitor on two different laptops with the original HDMI cable comes with the monitor. But the dark black always looks like dark grey. This cause all the movies looks washed out without depth. The same image/movie showed up on the laptop just fine - black is truly black. Not sure if this is the defect one, or it's the general problem with this model. If I can't solve the problem, I have to return the monitor. No one wants to watch a movie with wash out colors.
customer_reviews.author: GT

customer_reviews.title: So far it's great!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great screen. You can get the colors very accurate to a iMac. The anti-glare is also nice. At first I could not get the full resolution, only 1080p. I found out that if you use an adapter to go from mini-display (thunderbolt) to HDMI using the Amazon dongle it won't go to full resolution. I purchased a new cable that is mini-display to display port and the full 4k resolution was supported. I did put it to the 27" iMac resolution of 2560 by 1440 and it is great now. Keep in mind you are buying this for the picture quality, not the speakers because they are terrible.
customer_reviews.author: A. M. Steiner

customer_reviews.title: Read before you buy
customer_reviews.text: This monitor is pretty good. The picture and text look nice all the pixel count but I did ran into the some problems with this monitor. Like for instants the HDR for console gaming it’s way to bright for some games that has a lot of bright colors even using the eye protector didn’t even help with my problem. I couldn’t change the settings for it, its was already lock on its own settings. (Note that I have an Xbox one X) Sometimes it annoys me that I have to unplug my HDMI cable from this monitor and plug it in my old monitor, then switch back over so the HDR doesn’t mess up my games settings
customer_reviews.author: Toby Johns

customer_reviews.title: Red line on screen
customer_reviews.text: I played on this monitor for LESS than one hour and a red line straight down the screen had already developed. Tried different cords, games, settings, etc. Monitor already needed to be repaired. What a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas Cayce

customer_reviews.title: Great Monitor for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I received this monitor Monday Oct 1st, of course set it up immediately. And so far I’m very happy with it, i primarily use it for my PS4 Pro and the picture is excellent in my opinion of course. Especially for Shooters such as Rainbow Six Siege , Fortnite, Overwatch. Heck even Madden 19 looks amazing on this monitor so basically any story based game with or without HDR will look good. Now there are better monitors on the market but for a budget screen this will do the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Espinoza

customer_reviews.title: Great image, good price
customer_reviews.text: I use this as my main monitor for work (not gaming), and for photo processing. Although it supports 3840x2160 resolution, it becomes too small for use with text, so I ended up using a smaller resolution. Colors and brightness are great, and the price is very reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Schwabe

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality and sells at MSRP
customer_reviews.text: This is for the 144hz 1440p ips: it’s absolutely incredible for the price. It uses the same panel as the other 1440p 144hz ips panels as only one exists to my knowledge, and the feature set is top notch. I have yet to use a display port with it, due to the fact that it doesnt come with one which would be my only gripe, but its beautiful and silky smooth. I highly recommend an rtx 2070 or better, as I’m using a galax 2060 currently and I have yet to experience 144hz on qhd at max settings with AAA titles. It is truly a pleasure to use.
customer_reviews.author: Anton D.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Monitor Can't Wait To Use On Ps5!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best monitors if you plan on getting the PS5 or the new Xbox.I'm currently using it on the Xbox one and the graphics are amazing can't wait to use it on my PS5. The response time is also amazing very fast couldn't be more happy with my purchase✅
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: It’s display port detection is terrible
customer_reviews.text: The monitor absolutely will not switch to display port without having to shut down other hdmi devices. It just doesn’t work. I have to turn it off and back on several times. Sometimes having to reboot my entire system just to get it working again. It’s a MAJOR issue. Slows down when I’m not able to simply switch between ports.
customer_reviews.author: JoelDT

customer_reviews.title: Got it for MW, works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Was originally gaming(xbox 1) on my 60in TV and felt a lot of lag from when I saw something to when I was able to shoot or was getting shot. When I got this monitor, and played a few games, I could definitely tell the difference and didn't feel as though I was being shot way before I saw the person. Feels much more even when popping around the corner and being surprised by the enemy. Would definitely recommend for xbox gaming. FPS specifically.
customer_reviews.author: J. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Crystal clear
customer_reviews.text: I'm loving this gaming monitor. Originally I had my AMA setting set to premium instead of high and there was a slight ghosting effect. Once I changed that to high, everything is great. Goes perfect with my PlayStation 4 Pro. I also love watching movies on this way better then my regular flat screen. I leave hdr on and the eye assist off. If you're going to use it with the PlayStation 4 pro, just know you have to change the output settings in your PlayStation 4 settings to 1940. A display cord is not necessary. I went through so much trying to ensure I had 4K quality. Wanted to pass along what I've learned.
customer_reviews.author: Andre graham

customer_reviews.title: Beware
customer_reviews.text: Screen arrived with a crack/scratch at the top. Mointor constantly goes from bright to dim at random.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Jae

customer_reviews.title: Decent for what I paid for but....
customer_reviews.text: This monitor really has issues with black pixels in shadows and other dark areas regardless of the resolution its set to or brightness or any other setting available on my computer or RTX 2070 Super. Gaming isnt nearly as bad but trying to watch a movie is just black pixels for shadowing. But its great in every other aspect. It never runs hot, very bright and is a solid 4k monitor with hdr thats noticeable gaming
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas richardson

customer_reviews.title: dont waste your money
customer_reviews.text: i got this for for my xbox one x and the colors are extremely grayed out. the details are fine, but every game i play looks dull and weak on color playing on full 4k. Not sure why that is, but the settings on my xbox look fine. if someone figured out how to fix this, let me know because this is crappy for the $500 that i paid
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Great Monitor for Console Gaming
customer_reviews.text: Huge fan of this monitor. I use this for console gaming on the Xbox One X. Freesync works with the Xbox so all the stuttering and screen tears are gone. I like to play FPS games but have a tough time differentiating players from the shadows when playing on my TV, I just never see them. Specific example, I like to play Warzone, I could never see through windows or airplane hangers just because TVs don't have as good of contrast as gaming monitors IMO. Now, I see details through the shadows of the game. Don't plan on using the speakers, I use a headset. There is no light bleed. This was 100 percent worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: No power cable received and picture adjustments locked on HDMI
customer_reviews.text: Maybe for a PC it's good, but fir console it was GARBAGE. Almost all picture adjustments are locked on HDMI I suppose. And idk if I wasn't suppose to have gotten a power cord but I did not receive 1. Thankfully my neighbor just happened to have an extra from one of theirs. All in all AVOID IF ON CONSOLE!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ryne

customer_reviews.title: A solid monitor!
customer_reviews.text: After trying to look for a decent gaming monitor for about 2 months I finaly found the right one! This monitor is beautiful, graphics, sound and the refresh rate make it worth it. Dont think twice, this monitor has everything you could ask for in a gaming monitor. Also has gysnc available. Amazing work BenQ! Going to save up and get another one in the future
customer_reviews.author: adarsh

customer_reviews.title: Great Monitor for the budget gaming
customer_reviews.text: Overall solid performance. Have not had any dead pixels, streaks, flickering or other screen issues. Sound is better than I expected from a monitor. Did have a main power failure. Huge upside is the customer service. From me contacting them about the main power failure and me receiving the repaired monitor, it only took BenQ 12 days. Everything was under warranty and taken care of. I own a lot of electronics from various companies (including Samsung, Apple and other big brands) and BenQ has had the best customer service I have yet to witness. I can only recommend this monitor, if you are not looking to spend 1k.
customer_reviews.author: Blerp

customer_reviews.title: If you have an Xbox One X...
customer_reviews.text: If you have an xbox one x this is the perfect gaming monitor to bring out the best in your xbox. I have always played on big 55-65 inch tvs but i couldn't get over how clear and responsive this monitor was. I can't wait to get the next xbox hooked up to it.....i highly reccomend his monitor!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Doug W

customer_reviews.title: DEAD PIXEL BEWARE!!
customer_reviews.text: So yeah after doing some research and reading reviews I could say that I was really excited for this monitor and the gaming potential it has with the higher resolution and the higher hertz but unfortunately it came with a DEAD PIXEL which is highly distracting and inexcusable especially when dishing out $450 for an experience and being totally let down! 1/5 stars
customer_reviews.author: Brian Jones

customer_reviews.title: So far, really good
customer_reviews.text: **update**. Purchased a new video card and the screen flicker is completely gone. Great monitor in every way!! This review is still incomplete. I’ve had the monitor for 4 weeks and have noticed significant screen flicker on static images in games, specifically Fallout 76 while running 1440p @ 144hz. Still experimenting if the video card is the issue or there is an issue with the monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmer

customer_reviews.title: Washed out picture
customer_reviews.text: I should have listened to the reviews that said the color was washed out, but I thought I knew better. I spent about two hours messing with the settings, but didn’t make any progress. As you can see from my pictures, the cross-airs are completely gone in my first picture. I ended up starting a return and bought a Samsung monitor instead. It hasn’t showed yet, but it can’t be any worse. Overall, I expect much better from a $350 monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: First monitor in years, now I want a second one.
customer_reviews.text: It has been a few years since I purchased a new monitor. All of my past monitors and TVs were Samsung. Obviously the resolution was going to be better than my 1080P, but the color is also much better. This replaced an even older Samsung, now I want to replace the newer one also.
customer_reviews.author: Jeepin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent well rounded 1440p 144hz ips gaming panel!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent well rounded 1440p 144hz ips gaming panel! Crystal clear display... No bleeding or backlight problems... all pixels are perfect... Excellent response time... HDRi is emulated... not true HDR as the monitor lacks proper amount of nits for true hdr... but the emulated HDRi definitely gives a nice boost overall! The remote control makes this monitor extremely user friendly, ironically many may not even need as the moniter menu buttons and the volume knob are extremely user friendly as well. This is a good monitor! Stand may look on the cheaper side however has been very durable... Cannot be tilted too much...but it gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Was a little hesitant at first
customer_reviews.text: Monitor exceeds what I thought it would be. Unless your buying 144mhz or greater this unit is an excellent bang for your dollar. Product arrived new and packaged as expected. Easy setup, light for the size, was able to wall mount myself in minutes. Pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: It’s a good monitor for FPS games, I would recommend you play on a big 4K tv for casual gaming
customer_reviews.text: Okay so, the 4K looks great! I can’t say the same for the HDR in games that are 4K on Xbox one x, the HDR looks watered down and colors don’t look so great it lacks brightness and looks “warm” and the fact that we can’t adjust color or brightness in the settings makes it worst, other than that it looks great on other games that don’t need HDR such as overwatch etc.
customer_reviews.author: Chief

customer_reviews.title: Great Value For Money
customer_reviews.text: My experience with a 2018 MacBook Pro: - Great for productivity tasks. - Make sure you use a proper cable and dongle. I used out of date connectors and was limited to 1080p until I upgraded them. - For videos, movies and the like, I've noticed a lot of color distortions relative to my laptop's built-in display. When I plug the monitor directly into a blu-ray player and watch a movie, these distortions are not present. - Very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Anne O Mous

customer_reviews.title: Multiple issues but games look really good
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with a pixel stuck red. It the problem doesn’t resolve on its own soon I will try to get it replaced and update the review. Also packaging seemed mostly fine but there was a scuff in the plastic on the back of the monitor. Decently deep to so maybe I got a refurbished one somehow? Edit: just got my new replacement, no dead pixels are damage, just the volume knob could be nicer compared to the last one.
customer_reviews.author: Finesser

customer_reviews.title: Dead after 2 months.
customer_reviews.text: This monitor was pretty good for about 2 months then just refused to turn on tried multiple outlets multiple power cords but completely dead.
customer_reviews.author: Zat

customer_reviews.title: PSA: 1440p 144hz monitor does not come with a displayport cable
customer_reviews.text: Just so people know, the 1440p 144z style monitor does not come with a displayport cable. You paid for 144hz and to get that, you will need a displayport cable. It is in poor taste that BenQ does not include one in the box.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Jarvis

customer_reviews.title: 4K Gaming at a Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Have had this monitor now for about ten months. After countless hours of gaming with this monitor I can honestly say I am extremely satisfied with it. Picture looks great and it has a blue light setting that you can turn off so it’s a lot easier on the eyes to play games at night (real gamer hours). I play a lot of fps’s on it and it’s pretty responsive. Yeah, there are probably some high end monitors that look much better but if you want a quality upgrade to 4K at a decent price (not $800) this is it.
customer_reviews.author: Hayden C.

customer_reviews.title: Went through 2 of these monitor to see if light bleed/uniformity would be better, but not really.
customer_reviews.text: The monitor is great, but the light bleed and panel uniformity is little lacking. both of my monitor has slight blue tint on left brownish on the right. It also has little back light bleed/IPS glow on the left side as well as bottom of the panel. This is only visible when displaying dark scene/images so it's not a huge issue.
customer_reviews.author: Puspa

customer_reviews.title: Average monitor
customer_reviews.text: The built in speakers are very low. I emphasize in the very low built in speakers. The compatibility is okay, it won’t connect the sound to my receiver (DirectTV). The bezels are thick. 4K stimulated, not the best nor the worst for the price. Overall save your money for a better one. Down side you can control the volume with a remote. After 1-2 hours my eyes gets tired, my setting are on “blue light mode.” The quality of the build feels cheap such as the borders. Very simple setup if you don’t have many devices such as consoles or computers.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy l.

customer_reviews.title: PS4 Gaming On Console
customer_reviews.text: After a tiresome search for the right console under $300 I went with the BenQ EL2870U 28 inch HDR 4K Gaming Monitor | 1ms Response Time |FreeSync. I had to play with the settings for about 40 minutes...it's perfect, for me. :-) Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Really Great Monitor bit too bright for me
customer_reviews.text: I love the auto brightness sensor, but at its lowest setting the monitor is still to bright in a completely dark room. I wish the monitor gave you a offset for minimum, but sadly it does not.

customer_reviews.title: BENQ Can’t be Trusted
customer_reviews.text: The Benq 28 inch 4K unit is not worth your money. Colors are washed out no matter what setting you have it on. Color Saturation settings seem to be non existent. No dead pixels but the system has bugs and glitches.

customer_reviews.title: Colors are subpar, good response time and performance

I would say you might as well go for an ips monitor with better colors and a 5ms response especially at 60hz since the difference between 1ms and 5ms is hardly noticable. If you want a 1ms response time and don't care about picture and color accuracy then you can go with this one.

The image has a faulty coloration - Go to Picture and Reset Color, and then choose YES to reset the color settings to the factory defaults. If the image is still not correct and the OSD also has faulty coloration, this means one of the three primary colors is missing in the signal input. Now check the signal cable connectors. If any pin is bent or broken off, please contact your dealer to get necessary support. The image is distorted, flashes or flickers- Read the instructions on the link "Adjusting the Screen Resolution" on the CD, and then select the correct resolution, refresh rate and make adjustments based on these instructions. The image is blurred- read the instructions on the link "Adjusting the Screen Resolution “on the CD, and then select the correct resolution, refresh rate and make adjustments based on these instructions. If a VGA extension cable is used, remove the extension cable for the test. Is the image now in focus? If not, optimize the image by working through the instructions in the "Adjusting the refresh rate" section on the link "Adjusting the Screen Resolution". It is normal for blurring to occur due to conduction losses in extension cables. You can minimize these losses by using an extension cable with better conduction quality or with a built-in booster.
